keyword: how many calories in a cup of chicken
title: How Many Calories in a Cup of Chicken?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a cup of chicken, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown per cup with quick tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Cup of Chicken?
assumptions: Diced, cooked chicken breast, skinless and boneless; ~140 g per cup; roasted or boiled without added fats or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut (breast vs. thigh), cooking method, portion density, and added ingredients. Check labels or use a scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One cup of cooked chicken breast provides ~231 kcal and ~43 g protein.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts labels for straightforward comparison to packaged foods.

tweaks.label: Use chicken thigh instead of breast

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of cooked chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 231 kcal for 1 cup (~140 g) skinless, cooked chicken breast.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a cup of chicken?
faqs.a: About 43 g of protein per cup, making it a high-protein option.

faqs.q: Does a cup of chicken have carbs?
faqs.a: Plain cooked chicken has 0 g carbs, fiber, and sugars.

faqs.q: How does chicken cut affect calories in a cup?
faqs.a: Breast is leaner (~231 kcal); thighs add ~42 kcal more per cup due to higher fat.

faqs.q: Is raw or cooked weight used for a cup of chicken?
faqs.a: Cooked weight; raw chicken shrinks ~25% when cooked, so volumes differ.
